001package io.github.ai4ci.output;
002
003import java.util.stream.Stream;
004
005import org.immutables.value.Value;
006
007import io.github.ai4ci.abm.Outbreak;
008import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.CSVWriter;
009import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export;
010import io.github.ai4ci.flow.output.Export.Stage;
011
012/**
013 * A retrospective of test positives as determined on a given day.
014 *
015 * <p>
016 * Main purpose: provide a timeâ€‘observation matrix showing test positivity by
017 * sample date and result date to illustrate right censoring and reporting
018 * delay. Produces multiple rows per simulation day and is therefore suitable
019 * for testing delay analyses.
020 *
021 * <p>
022 * Downstream uses: analysis of testing delay distributions and reporting
023 * completeness, used by test reporting and delay calibration routines.
024 *
025 * @author Rob Challen
026 */
027@Value.Immutable
028@Export(
029                stage = Stage.UPDATE,
030                value = "test-positivity.csv",
031                size = 64 * 64,
032                selector = OutbreakHistoryCSV.Selector.class,
033                writer = CSVWriter.class
034)
035public interface OutbreakHistoryCSV extends CommonCSV.State {
036
037        /**
038         * Selector for outbreak history CSV export. This produces one row per
039         * observation time (result day) for each entry in the outbreak history, with
040         * test positivity counts by sample date.
041         */
042        static class Selector implements Export.Selector {
043                @Override
044                public Stream<OutbreakHistoryCSV> apply(Outbreak o) {
045                        return o.getHistory().stream().map(CSVMapper.INSTANCE::toCSV);
046                }
047        }
048
049        /**
050         * Number of negative tests counted by sample date for the associated time.
051         *
052         * @return the count of test negatives by sample date that are recorded for
053         *         the observation time
054         */
055        long getCurrentTestNegativesBySampleDate();
056
057        /**
058         * Number of positive tests counted by sample date for the associated time.
059         *
060         * @return the count of test positives by sample date that are recorded for
061         *         the observation time (may be right censored depending on delay)
062         */
063        long getCurrentTestPositivesBySampleDate();
064
065        /**
066         * Observation time (result day) associated with this row.
067         *
068         * @return the observation or result time used to anchor the test positivity
069         *         count; this is typically the day the test result became available
070         */
071        int getObservationTime();
072
073        // TODO: Testing reporting delay is only delay to result being available and
074        // not for data reporting delay
075        // TODO: There are no reporting delays for death or admission.
076        // TODO: There is no time dependence in reporting delay at weekends
077
078}
